Package project1

Class ShoppingBag

java.lang.Object
project1.ShoppingBag
public class ShoppingBag
extends java.lang.Object

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private GroceryItem[] bag  
    private int capacity  
    private int size  
    (package private) static double taxPercent  

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    ShoppingBag()
    Creates a ShoppingBag object with an array of 5 null GroceryItems, a size of 0 and a capacity (for storing items) of 5.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void add​(GroceryItem item)
    Adds a GroceryItem item to the shopping bag, increases its size by 1, and checks if the shopping bag is full (when the bag's size is equivalent to its capacity).
    private int find​(GroceryItem item)
    Fetches the location of a GroceryItem item in the shopping bag.
    private void grow()
    Grows the capacity of the shopping bag by creating a new array that contains all of the items in the original shopping bag, and has 5 more empty GroceryItem spaces that can be filled.
    static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
    This is our testbed main method.
    void makeEmpty()
    Sets all of the GroceryItem items in the shopping bag to null, which empties the contents of the shopping bag.
    int numOfItems()
    Finds the number of GroceryItem items in the shoppingBag, which is equivalent to the size of the shopping bag.
    void print()
    Prints out the string version of all of the GroceryItem items in the shopping bag.
    boolean remove​(GroceryItem item)
    Removes a GroceryItem item from the Shoppingbag by first finding the item's index.
    double salesPrice()
    Finds the total price of all of the GroceryItem items in the shoppingBag by iterating through the array shoppingBag, and adding the price of every item to the variable for the total price (totalSales).
    double salesTax()
    Finds the total sales tax by iterating through the shoppingBag to get the total price of all GroceryItem items in the bag which are taxable, and then multiplying this total price by the tax percent (0.06625).

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • taxPercent

      static final double taxPercent
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • bag

      private GroceryItem[] bag

    • size

      private int size

    • capacity

      private int capacity

  • Constructor Details

    • ShoppingBag

      public ShoppingBag()
      Creates a ShoppingBag object with an array of 5 null GroceryItems, a size of 0 and a capacity (for storing items) of 5.

  • Method Details

    • find

      private int find​(GroceryItem item)
      Fetches the location of a GroceryItem item in the shopping bag.
      Parameters:
      item - (an instance of GroceryItem)
      Returns:
      the index of the item if it exists in the bag, otherwise returns -1 (item was not found)

    • grow

      private void grow()
      Grows the capacity of the shopping bag by creating a new array that contains all of the items in the original shopping bag, and has 5 more empty GroceryItem spaces that can be filled.

    • add

      public void add​(GroceryItem item)
      Adds a GroceryItem item to the shopping bag, increases its size by 1, and checks if the shopping bag is full (when the bag's size is equivalent to its capacity). If it is, we grow the bag.
      Parameters:
      item - (an instance of GroceryItem)

    • remove

      public boolean remove​(GroceryItem item)
      Removes a GroceryItem item from the Shoppingbag by first finding the item's index. Then, it checks to see if the index is valid (meaning it is not -1). If the index is equal to the size (meaning the object is in the last position) we set the last reference to null. Else we make the GroceryItem at the index refer to the object referred by the last GoceryItem, and we set the last GrocerItem to null.
      Parameters:
      item - (an instance of GroceryItem)
      Returns:
      true if the item was able to be removed, false otherwise

    • salesPrice

      public double salesPrice()
      Finds the total price of all of the GroceryItem items in the shoppingBag by iterating through the array shoppingBag, and adding the price of every item to the variable for the total price (totalSales).
      Returns:
      value of total price (of all GroceryItems in shopping bag)

    • salesTax

      public double salesTax()
      Finds the total sales tax by iterating through the shoppingBag to get the total price of all GroceryItem items in the bag which are taxable, and then multiplying this total price by the tax percent (0.06625).
      Returns:
      tax, which represents the total sales tax

    • print

      public void print()
      Prints out the string version of all of the GroceryItem items in the shopping bag.

    • numOfItems

      public int numOfItems()
      Finds the number of GroceryItem items in the shoppingBag, which is equivalent to the size of the shopping bag.
      Returns:
      size of shopping bag

    • makeEmpty

      public void makeEmpty()
      Sets all of the GroceryItem items in the shopping bag to null, which empties the contents of the shopping bag. Then, it sets the size of the shopping bag to 0, as it is no longer filled with any items.

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      This is our testbed main method. Every important line is commented with its purpose. It tests the add, remove, grow, and SalesTax methods of ShoppingBag class.
      Parameters:
      args - (takes in an input stream)
